intro: Zosterophyllanthos calolalax, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Zosterophyllanthos calolalax thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along streambanks.
